intro: Amsinckia delicata, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Amsinckia delicata is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, which benefits the surrounding ecosystem.
